title: Disconnecting for the last 3 days... Pleas assist.
body:
Hello, I have no idea if anybody here could even help me but for the last 2-3 days I've been experiencing lapses of the game where my ping spikes to 350 and I can't move for 2-3 seconds every 30 seconds. I've dropped a significant amount of divisions because of this and it's made the game simply unplayable and very anti-fun. I have no idea what to do anymore, there is no other devices connected to the WI-FI in my house and I'm the only person using the internet, I've tried changing my DNS, removing every connected device, countless other things.

The only other thing I could think of is to re-install LoL but I don't know if this would make any difference.

If it helps my ISP is Telstra.

replies.body:
Hey Exiled Riven,

Did anything change in your home internet/network setup around when you started seeing the issue?

Couple of suggestions:

* Try getting rid of the Wifi for a game or two - try using a cable to connect direct to your router.
* Run a trace route to 103.240.227.1 (post results)
* Check through the suggestions in the [Troubleshooting Connection Issues](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) support page

Let me know how you go

Cheers
Mindstar

Hello, thanks for the reply. Unfortunately due to the position of where my PC is in retrospect to the routers location I can't set up a wired connection. Nothing has changed in regards to my connection in recent times also.

I've attached a screenshot of the trace route for you to look at. Thanks. 

To clarify again it's not a constant lagg, my ping is usual at say 60 ping then randomly spikes to 150-200 for 2-3 seconds.

https://gyazo.com/83f35ed13b5220f364dca58af76091c3

Hey,

If there is a way you can move your computer near your router and/or use a long cable to test, it would be a really good idea.  The type of ping spikes you mention are typical of an unreliable connection, which lines up either with a congested wifi channel, router cpu/overloading issues or congestion on the network path between you and the game server.

Additionally, you'll need to run that traceroute from your computer (not from a website).  It is important to make sure you are tracing the path from yourself to the game servers.  [Instructions here](https://support.cloudflare.com/hc/en-us/articles/200169336-How-do-I-run-a-traceroute-) (replace _yourdomain.com_ with 103.240.227.1)

Another thing you can do is check your logs out in [Logs of Lag](http://logsoflag.com/), which might help get a better picture of the problem.

Cheers
Mindstar
